english.segment1: It's the first day. Since I handed you your final rose. In your house. I'm staring out the window at our tree (We planted below)
english.segment2: The heights of which. You'll never. Ever know
english.segment3: You always. Were there to rescue me. From December
english.segment4: I wonder if you'll look the same. When you embrace me on that day. Will you remember my name. When I return home again?
english.segment5: In my mind's eye. I see you next to me as I'm on my knees. It's in this place. That you showed me how to ask eternity
english.segment6: For shelter. For comfort. For relief
english.segment7: You always. Were there to rescue me. From December
english.segment8: I see our branches stretching. To heights you'd not believe. One day these leaves will reach you. And there will be no more
english.segment10: You always gave me refuge. Unconditional. You always offered shelter. From December's snow. My chin still rests upon you. While my feet they sway. I wonder if you'll look the same. When you embrace me. On that day.
